body:
> Hi @penghuazhou, Which version are you using？

master

> > Hi @penghuazhou, Which version are you using？
> 
>@lanchengx  master

Hi @CrackerSuperior ,
There is a new issue for DistSQL to support other config ways to replace configuration files:https://github.com/apache/shardingsphere/issues/13087
so I will cloes this issue. 
Thanks for your feedback.

@penghuazhou thanks, 
could you show what the actual SQL sent by the ORM to the proxy is?
thanks, could you find the SQL sent to the proxy when using `?` as a placeholder, such as through debug, or change the proxy log level to debug.

@penghuazhou 
Please adjust the log level of Proxy to `DEBUG`, and then observe the SQL received by Proxy.
This configuration is in `logback.xml`:
```
<logger name="org.apache.shardingsphere" level="debug" additivity="false">
        <appender-ref ref="console" />
    </logger>
```

And the key words of log: `Execute packet type`

@lanchengx , It the debug message

[DEBUG] 2021-10-18 16:45:07.914 [nioEventLoopGroup-3-2] o.a.s.db.protocol.codec.PacketCodec - Read from client 3c5268a4 :

|00000030| 73 75 6c 74 22 20 57 48 45 52 45 20 61 70 70 5f |sult" WHERE app_|

+--------+-------------------------------------------------+----------------+
|00000000| 5a 00 00 00 05 49                               |Z....I          |
+--------+-------------------------------------------------+----------------+

It seems that the connection has been successful, but the database and table information is incorrect, because the way Postgre obtains information is different from that of MySQL, and this part needs to be improved.
But you can execute your own business SQL without worrying about whether the metadata is displayed correctly.
Hi @tristaZero, please take a review, thank you!
Hi @DogeC0in , `5.0.0-RC1` is planned to release at these days, `5.0.0` at November.

@DogeC0in 
Please refer to https://github.com/apache/shardingsphere/discussions/12916.
Sorry that the log display is not complete. We adjusted the display of the log. Please update the latest code and use the debug level to view and copy the log.
but I can not use pgadmin4，do you have a gui tools to connect to shardsphere-proxy?
>@RaigorJiang  but I can not use pgadmin4，do you have a gui tools(a postgresql database client tool) to connect to shardsphere-proxy?
@lanchengx I download it now?

Can you try Navicat or DataGrip?
https://shardingsphere.apache.org/document/current/en/others/faq/#6-proxy-how-to-use-a-suitable-database-tools-connecting-shardingsphere-proxy
Yes, modified in https://github.com/apache/shardingsphere/pull/13095

Yes, I'll add some tests for this
Thanks, looking forward to your pr

> do you know why return "'pg_catalog' doesn't exist"? It exists in database

Because when you are using ShardingSphere-Proxy, the `schema` is what you defined in Proxy configuration.
Users cannot directly access the metadata of a physical database, because in a distributed database system, the information of a single database may not be complete.

However, access to metadata is very important to some SQL clients, so this part still needs support, and we are already sorting out related plans.
@tristaZero - I merged in master and resolved the conflicts. I have not much experience with ANTLR, just learning it.
@tuichenchuxin - I updated the branch, could you take a brief look at it again and tell me if something should be changed? Thank you!

Hello, 👋 if you assign it to me I can give it a try in the scope of Hacktoberfest. 
Already created a PR for it here: https://github.com/apache/shardingsphere/pull/13107
@penghuazhou Sorry, some omissions cause compilation exceptions, please update the code and make sure that the compilation is passed and try again

This issue may relates to https://github.com/apache/shardingsphere/issues/10814

> This issue may relates to #10814

thanks, when will support sql parameter?

@penghuazhou 
Could you provide example codes in text format? I might try the Golang client after #10814 fixed.
@RaigorJiang DataGrip：2021.1 can execute sql, but can not show databases message
Yes, because the way postgre queries schema and table metadata is different from MySQL, this is a known issue, and we will fix it later.

> Looks master branch has the same logic:
> 
> ```
> throw new ShardingSphereException("Can not update sharding key, logic table: [%s], column: [%s].", tableName, shardingColumn);
> ```
> 
> @LightShine , could we just shard by `user_id`? Since `user_phone` is sharding column, if it's changeable, it'll cause data record redistribution.

no. In our scenario, user_id and user_phone need to be used for sharding. Moreover, my problem is that the update sql should not determine the existence of the sharding key in the set-statament.
